name: Ann Peebles
description: '''Ann Lee Peebles''' (born April 27, 1947) is an American retired singer and songwriter who gained popularity for her [[Memphis soul]] albums of the 1970s while signed to [[Hi Records]]. Her most successful singles include "[[I Can't Stand the Rain (song)|I Can't Stand the Rain]]", which she wrote with her husband [[Don Bryant (songwriter)|Don Bryant]] and radio broadcaster Bernie Miller, and "[[I'm Gonna Tear Your Playhouse Down]]". In 2014, she was inducted into the [[Memphis Music Hall of Fame]].
